column4: hi, i had my computer upgraded to ubuntu feisty from edgy by my bf, was working fine for a few days but now i can't connect to the internet through my router and the graphical display won't start (this is a spare computer i'm using)
you could also just reinstall ubuntu
when gnome is broken, i found it difficult to fix
i don't know how
that could be a problem
and whats to stop it happening again after a couplel of days? there was no apparant reason.. was watchin a film last night and this morning it doesn't work
thats true
when it loads it has a blue screen with characters around the edge and some error output.. says something about a stack trace
and if i want to view some other output as well..
try disabling the automatic updates...it could have installed something that broke it
where do i do that?
well you need to be in ubuntu, which you cant since then GUI is broken
what i mean is, re-install ubuntu and stop it from automatically updating itself
ok
will see if i have a cd
if thats the only option
it's a very nice computer though.. should be better than this :(
you can have the most expensive computer in the world and software will still crash
thats like saying that cars wont crash if you make roads properly :P
ok
thanks
